oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Comparison of Doramectin and Ivermectin/Clorsulon for the Control of Gastrointestinal Nematodes and Weight Gains in Stocker Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Williams, J. C.
DeRosa, A.
Loyacano, A. F.
Gurie, J.
Coombs, D. F.
Skogerboe, T. L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: doramectin
ivermectin/clorsulon
injectable solution
nematode infection
liver fluke contamination
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A 140-day grazing study (December 20, 1995-May 8, 1996) was conducted in Louisiana to compare the efficacy of doramectin (Dectomax®) injectable solution and ivermectin/clorsulon (Ivomec Plus®) injectable solution when administered to stocker beef cattle with naturally acquired nematode infections and grazing on liver fluke contaminated pastures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1997; 185
